snippet: After Harry Shunk, a photographer and a mysterious figure in the art world, died, Darryl Kelly was hired to clean out his apartment, where he found troves of valuable art that he now hopes to auction.
abstract: Bronx cleanup specialist Darryl Kelly recently revealed troves of valuable art that he found in trash that he had been hired to remove from the Manhattan apartment of famed photographer Harry Shunk after the artist died in poverty in 2006, leaving no will or relatives; Roy Lichtenstein Foundation has given indication that it might be interested in some of the pieces rescued by Kelly, who plans to auction off what appears to be a valuable collection.
lead_paragraph: After Harry Shunk, a photographer and a mysterious figure in the art world, died, Darryl Kelly was hired to clean out his apartment, where he found troves of valuable art that he now hopes to auction.

headline.seo: After a Recluse’s Death, a Cleanup Man Reaps a Trove of Art
